result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank E Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 16-CF-54, 16-CF-55, 15-CM-19, 15-CM-119 & 15-CM-147. Credit for time served.
To pay the costs of the action.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank E Thomas in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument.  Defendant apologizes, makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
9/21/17 ltr to Court re: rescheduling
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 26, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank E Thomas in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank E Thomas in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer asks court to set matter for pleas and sentencing. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank Thomas in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates she has not been PD appointed on the new charges but assumes she probably will be. Court adjourns matter until counsel is appointed in new files. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Frank E Thomas appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates the court date slipped his mind, tried contacting his attorney. State indicates defendant is facing new charges, requests amendment to his bond. Court sets cash bond, all conditions remain as previously set.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in custody.

Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer doesn't know where defendant is, she hasn't been able to reach him. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
Defendant was fingerprinted 12/07/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 5/10/16)
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Defense Discovery Demand
State's Discovery Demand

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Schaefer requests a status in January. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates defendant is in the Brown County Jail being held on a cash bond for new charges.  State asks court to reschedule all matters until after his November arraignment in Brown County. Court reschedules matters.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
